cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend, crossing Florida into southeast Georgia and the coastal Carolinas, and then moving offshore into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (between Englewood and Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Chokoloskee FL to Indian Pass FL (incl. Tampa Bay); Hurricane Watch: Englewood FL to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: South of Englewood to Chokoloskee FL and Lower FL Keys west of Seven Mile Bridge
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Pinar del Rio Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning: Yucatan Peninsula Tulum–Rio Lagartos incl. Cozumel, Isle of Youth, Dry Tortugas FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeast Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt with higher gusts) possible late Wed night–Thu; peak wind-probability 44 %
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft inundation along the South Carolina coast, including Charleston Harbor, around Thursday high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 4–8 inches, locally higher, Wednesday night through Thursday causing flash/urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents and large surf ahead of the storm
